People

Students

Alyssa Frazee is a Ph.D. student in Biostatistics at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. She built derfinder, ballgown and RSkittleBrewer writes an awesome blog which has appeared on the front page of Hacker News.


Leonardo Collado Torres is a Ph.D. student in Biostatistics at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. He built the new derfinder and derfinderReport. He also writes a fantastic blog.


Prasad Patil is a Ph.D. student in Biostatistics at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. He created healthvis and is creating cross-platform, cheap genomic signatures for cancer, lupus, and other diseases.


Postdocs

Abhi Nellore is a postdoc in Biostatistics and Computer Science. He is co-advised with Ben Langmead and is developing tools for scalable RNA-seq analysis.


Faculty

Jeff Leek is an Associate Professor of Biostatistics and Oncology at the Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health. His research focuses on the intersection of high dimensional data analysis, genomics, and public health. He is the co-editor of the Simply Statistics Blog and co-director of the Johns Hopkins Specialization in Data Science.
